title_sort: bethuel smith to walt whitman, 13 october 1863
title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 13 October 1863
text: WashingtonOct the 13 1863Dear FriendI now sit down to write to write you a few lines to let you now where I am I am with the regiment now. I left Carlisle about one week ago and have ben[been] diledaleying[dilly-dallying] around & have not had time to rite to you untill[until] now & I have not got much time now the toe is most all healed up but my foot is swelled so that I can not get my boot on it swelled from walking from the depot out her but I think that will go down in a day or to the brigade is gone out to the front again & I dont[don't] now but we shall follow them pretty soon I dont[don't] now as I can write anny[any] more at present So good by for this time Bethuel Smith Co. F. 2nd U. S. Cav.Washington DC Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 13 October 1863
